|   | A terrible weapon, woven in the depths of the inferno.***“With a terrible cry the Balrog fell forward, and its shadow plunged down and vanished. But even as it fell it swung its whip, and the thongs lashed and curled about the wizard's knees, dragging him to the brink. He staggered, and fell, grasped vainly at the stone, and slid into the abyss.”-J.R.R. Tolkien, \_The Fellowship of the Ring\_. II, 5, “The Bridge of Khazad-dûm”. 1954. |

> This weapon falls into the [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") category. It is a one handed weapon.

**Demon whips** are one of the best one-handed weapons. They have a superb mindelay and good damage output.

Worshippers of [good](/Good "Good") [gods](/God "God") cannot attack with them without suffering [penance](/Penance "Penance"). However, worshippers of [the Shining One](/The_Shining_One "The Shining One") can convert a demon whip into a [sacred scourge](/Sacred_scourge "Sacred scourge"), with better stats and the [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath") brand. You can reverse the process with [Kikubaaqudgha](/Kikubaaqudgha "Kikubaaqudgha")'s or [Lugonu](/Lugonu "Lugonu")'s blessing.

## Strategy

Demon weapons are often found on the [hell knights](/Hell_knight "Hell knight") in the [Depths](/Depths "Depths") and the [Vestibule of Hell](/Vestibule_of_Hell "Vestibule of Hell"), often with good [enchantment](/Enchant "Enchant") levels and [brands](/Brand "Brand"). They can also be found early in the hands of [Amaemon](/Amaemon "Amaemon").

### Compared to eveningstar

The differences between demon whips and [eveningstars](/Eveningstar "Eveningstar") are small. A +9 [branded](/Brand "Brand") eveningstar is enough to win you the game, as is a +9 branded demon whip. Generally, the weapon you get *first* should be the one that you use. (The weapon you get first can benefit first from [scrolls of enchant weapon](/Scrolls_of_enchant_weapon "Scrolls of enchant weapon")).

There are cases where specific comparison is warranted, such as [artefact](/Artefact "Artefact") weapons. Against a 0 AC opponent, a +0 demon whip is roughly 2.6% stronger than a +0 eveningstar. The demon whip attacks faster, so it is penalized more by [AC](/AC "AC"), and conversely benefits more from [slaying](/Slaying "Slaying") and [auxiliary attacks](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack"). Characters with lots of auxiliary attacks, like [Vine Stalkers](/Vine_Stalker "Vine Stalker") and monstrous [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") will prefer a demon whip. Otherwise, it is mostly even: if you are at mindelay with both weapons, the eveningstar is favored slightly. This is independent of a character's [strength](/Strength "Strength") or skill.

## History

Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), demon whips dealt slightly more damage than normal in the hands of [demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") characters.
